ygData.subject: Re: RGB version of picbreeder?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Stephen, We do intend to add color to Picbreeder and you are right about the main reason we haven t done it yet: Often color makes it harder to get images

Hi Stephen, 

We do intend to add color to Picbreeder and you are right abo=
ut the 
main reason we haven't done it yet: Often color makes it harder to =

get images that look like something.  So when we do add color, we 
want to=
 do it the best way possible.  In fact, there are many ways 
of doing color=
 with CPPNs, and we are going to make sure we do 
something sensible that p=
reserve's Picbreeder's ability to evolve 
objects that look meaningful.  It=
 may be something that has not been 
tried before (and may not be based on =
RGB).  Ideally it will also 
allow users to colorize existing black and whi=
te images too and 
evolve from there.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, St=
ephen Waits <steve@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Ken,
> 
> Have you considered this?  =
Why did you go with a single dimension 
of  
> output?
> 
> I imagine that =
with the monochromatic version, it's easier to 
obtain  
> recognizable obj=
ects, because we are focussed primarily on shapes 
and  
> shading (depth).=
  But in RGB I bet it would be harder to obtain  
> recognizable objects be=
cause while we might obtain the right 
shapes,  
> the colors would seem od=
d.  However, I'm also betting that we 
could  
> come up with some pretty i=
nteresting artwork this way.
> --
> Stephen Waits
> steve@...

ts.com/
